import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt


r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt. subplots (
subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'}
)
ax.plot (theta, r) 
ax.set_rticks ([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2]) 
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: Simple Quarto Presentation
text:
Plot with Code Folding


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Generate data for plotting
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Plot the sine wave
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('x')
plt.ylabel('sin(x)')
plt.show()




Sine Wave Plot






Wilson, Judith. 1988. “Ndebele: The Art of an African Tribe.” JSTOR.
